material_name_notes: Also referred to as MAF-X27ox (2') in Liao et al. (EES).
Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: Monodentate metal–OH sites; reversible bicarbonate formation under CO2.
Data_source_ref_notes: Energy & Environmental Science: Liao et al. 'Monodentate hydroxide as a super strong yet reversible active site...' (accepted manuscript). Provides working capacity and regeneration-energy estimate for 2'.
real_air_validation_criteria: TGA/flow cycling: adsorption in 15:85 CO2/N2 (v/v) at 313 K; desorption in pure CO2 at 383 K (TSA) and/or N2 at 358 K (TVSA-like); tested at high RH (82%) for 0.10–0.15 bar CO2 flue-gas simulation.
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: No 400 ppm, 25°C, RH50 equilibrium uptake reported in the cited source.
CO2_working_capacity_cycle_mmol_g_notes: Reported TSA working capacity for 2' between 15:85 CO2/N2 at 313 K and pure CO2 flow at 383 K.
Full_cycle_time_min_notes: Cycle time not explicitly reported (figure-only in source).
Humidity_penalty_RH70_pct_notes: Not reported as RH70 vs RH50; source demonstrates capture at ~82% RH under flue-gas CO2 partial pressure.
Lowest_regen_energy_total_scoped_MJ_per_: Source estimate for 2': ~2.7 MJ required to regenerate 1 kg CO2, based on measured heat capacity over 313↔383 K (scope primarily sensible/thermal; excludes plant-level fan/compression unless otherwise stated).
Regen_temperature_C_notes: TSA desorption condition reported as pure CO2 flow at 383 K (also reports N2 purge at 358 K in TVSA-like cycling).
Regen_mode_notes: TSA process defined in source between 313 K adsorption and 383 K desorption using a CO2 purge.
Metric_confidence_notes: Defined cycle working capacity + regeneration-energy estimate reported, but under flue-gas CO2 partial pressure (not 400 ppm DAC).

material_name_notes: Interpenetrated hybrid ultramicroporous MOF (HUM).
Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: Electrostatic attraction in ultramicropores (SiF6^2- lined channels); physisorption with Qst ~40 kJ/mol.
Form_factor_tested_notes: Single-crystal/powder sorption measurements reported; no structured form factor specified in source.
Data_source_ref_notes: Kortright et al., J. Phys. Chem. C (2017): CO2/N2 isotherms at 298 K; Qst ≈ 40 kJ/mol; CO2 saturation ~6 mmol/g; insensitivity to water noted.
real_air_validation_criteria: Room-temperature single-component gas sorption isotherms (CO2 and N2) and in situ X-ray absorption spectroscopy vs PCO2 up to 200 Torr.
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: Reported CO2 uptake at pCO2=0.4 mbar (400 ppm equivalent) and 298 K; humidity not specified for this value.
Humidity_penalty_RH70_pct_notes: Source states desorption ease and insensitivity to water, but does not quantify RH70 vs RH50 penalty.
Regen_temperature_C_notes: Not reported as a defined regeneration temperature (focus is physisorption isotherms and spectroscopy).
Metric_confidence_notes: Trace-CO2 (400 ppm) and humid-air cycling metrics not identified in accessible sources; only general sorption properties and qualitative humidity tolerance.

material_name_notes: Also referred to as MAF-X25ox (1') in Liao et al. (EES).
Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: Monodentate metal–OH sites; reversible bicarbonate formation under CO2.
Data_source_ref_notes: Energy & Environmental Science: Liao et al. 'Monodentate hydroxide as a super strong yet reversible active site...' (accepted manuscript). Mixed-gas TGA data for 1'/2' reported.
real_air_validation_criteria: TGA mixed-gas cycling: 15:85 CO2/N2 (v/v) at 313 K (ads) and pure N2 at 358 K (des/regeneration); tested at high RH (82%) for 0.10–0.15 bar CO2 flue-gas simulation.
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: No 400 ppm, 25°C, RH50 equilibrium uptake reported in the cited source.
CO2_working_capacity_cycle_mmol_g_notes: Converted from reported repeatable mass change ~13.1 wt% for 1' under the 313 K (15% CO2/N2) ↔ 358 K (N2) TGA cycle.
Full_cycle_time_min_notes: Cycle time not explicitly reported (figure-only in source).
Humidity_penalty_RH70_pct_notes: Not reported as RH70 vs RH50; source demonstrates capture at ~82% RH under flue-gas CO2 partial pressure.
Regen_temperature_C_notes: Regeneration condition reported as N2 purge at 358 K.
Regen_mode_notes: Source describes N2 purge at 358 K as a typical regeneration method for a TVSA-like process (no explicit vacuum level stated).
Metric_confidence_notes: Mixed-gas cycling and high-humidity performance reported, but under flue-gas CO2 partial pressure (not 400 ppm DAC).

material_name_notes: mmen = N,N′-dimethylethylenediamine; appended to open Cu sites in CuBTTri (triazolate-bridged framework).
Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: Chemisorption between appended diamine and CO2 (high Qst reported).
Data_source_ref_notes: Chemical Science 2011 McDonald et al.: mmen-CuBTTri shows reversible CO2 uptake and rapid regeneration; 72-cycle test reported.
real_air_validation_criteria: Cycling demonstrated: adsorption from 0.15 bar CO2/0.75 bar N2 at 25°C; regeneration at 60°C; cycling time 27 min; 72 adsorption/desorption cycles with no loss.
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: No 400 ppm, 25°C, RH50 equilibrium uptake reported in the cited source (reports 0.15 bar CO2 mixture uptake).
CO2_working_capacity_cycle_mmol_g_notes: Adsorption capacity under 0.15 bar CO2/0.75 bar N2 at 25°C is 2.38 mmol/g; source states uptake is fully reversible, so this is used as an approximate per-cycle working capacity.
Sorbent_productivity_grav_kgCO2_per_kg_p: Calculated from working capacity and cycle time (assumes full reversibility each cycle as stated in source).
Metric_confidence_notes: Defined cycle and multi-cycle stability reported, but at flue-gas CO2 partial pressure (0.15 bar), not DAC.

material_name_notes: Primary source reports dmen-Mg2(dobpdc) ("1-dmen"); "dopdc" here assumed to refer to the same dobpdc framework naming shorthand.
Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: Diamine-appended open-metal-site MOF; cooperative chemisorption (ammonium carbamate chain formation) typical of these systems.
Data_source_ref_notes: Chemical Science 2015 (Wade et al.): reports low-temperature regeneration and cycling behavior for dmen-Mg2(dobpdc) ("1-dmen").
real_air_validation_criteria: TSA cycling described: adsorb in 15% CO2/N2 at 40°C for 1 h; desorb at 75°C for 1 h under Ar; 24 cycles with no capacity loss. Also includes humidity-exposure tests (100% RH short exposure) and vacuum regeneration discussion.
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: No explicit 400 ppm, 25°C, RH50 equilibrium uptake reported in the cited source.
CO2_working_capacity_cycle_mmol_g_notes: Working capacity reported as 11.6 wt% at Tdes = 75°C (converted to mmol/g). Source indicates adsorption at 0.15 bar CO2 at 40°C and desorption at 1 bar CO2 at Tdes (model/estimate; see source discussion).
Full_cycle_time_min_notes: Cycle described as 60 min adsorption + 60 min desorption in TSA recyclability test.
Sorbent_productivity_grav_kgCO2_per_kg_p: Calculated from working capacity (mmol/g) × 44.01 g/mol and 1440 min/day ÷ cycle time; uses 120 min cycle (1 h ads + 1 h des).
t90_adsorption_400ppm_RH50_min_notes: Kinetics reported in source are for flue-gas CO2 partial pressure (e.g., 15% CO2), not 400 ppm.
Humidity_penalty_RH70_pct_notes: Source includes humidity-exposure experiments but not a quantified RH70 vs RH50 penalty.
Regen_temperature_C_notes: TSA desorption temperature used in cycling demonstration (also discusses vacuum regeneration without heating).
Regen_mode_notes: Also discusses VSA/vacuum desorption at room temperature without heating (not captured in this primary cycle context).
Metric_confidence_notes: Defined cycle + multi-cycle test reported, but not under DAC (400 ppm) conditions.

material_name_notes: Parent framework used for diamine-appended variants; open metal sites.
Form_factor_tested_notes: Referenced as comparison sorbent in cited source (TGA).
Data_source_ref_notes: Chemical Science 2015 (Wade et al.): provides comparative working-capacity values vs diamine-appended variants under flue-gas-like cycling conditions.
real_air_validation_criteria: Comparison via TGA working-capacity analysis under simulated flue gas (15% CO2/N2) adsorption at 40°C and high-temperature desorption (reported at 130°C in comparison).
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: Table value reported for 0.4 mbar CO2 at 298 K; humidity not specified in the table (likely dry isotherm).
CO2_working_capacity_cycle_mmol_g_notes: Converted from reported working capacity 4.5 wt% for Mg2(dobpdc) under the comparison cycle conditions in the cited source.
Regen_temperature_C_notes: Comparison in cited source references desorption temperature 130°C for working-capacity benchmarking.
Metric_confidence_notes: Only a comparative working-capacity value extracted (cycle details not fully specified for this material in-source).

material_name_notes: Corresponds to MIL-101(Cr) sample A (~150 nm) impregnated with PEI (MW ~300) in Lin et al. (2014).
Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: PEI-impregnated amine sorbent (chemisorption).
Data_source_ref_notes: J. Mater. Chem. A (2014) Lin et al.: polyamine/MIL-101(Cr) composites; compares particle sizes (~150 vs 250 nm) and PEI MW; reports CO2 uptake at 25°C, 0.15 bar.
real_air_validation_criteria: Single-component CO2 adsorption isotherms at 25°C (and other characterization) for PEI-loaded MIL-101(Cr) nanoparticle composites.
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: No 400 ppm, 25°C, RH50 uptake reported in the cited source.
CO2_working_capacity_cycle_mmol_g_notes: Source reports adsorption capacity at 0.15 bar CO2 (25°C) but does not report a defined adsorption–desorption working capacity under DAC-like cycling.
Metric_confidence_notes: Only non-DAC adsorption capacity metrics identified (e.g., 0.15 bar); no defined DAC cycle/energy/kinetics extracted.

material_name_notes: Corresponds to MIL-101(Cr) sample B (~250 nm) impregnated with PEI (MW ~300) in Lin et al. (2014).
Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: PEI-impregnated amine sorbent (chemisorption).
Data_source_ref_notes: J. Mater. Chem. A (2014) Lin et al.: polyamine/MIL-101(Cr) composites; compares particle sizes (~150 vs 250 nm) and PEI MW; reports CO2 uptake at 25°C, 0.15 bar.
real_air_validation_criteria: Single-component CO2 adsorption isotherms at 25°C (and other characterization) for PEI-loaded MIL-101(Cr) nanoparticle composites.
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: No 400 ppm, 25°C, RH50 uptake reported in the cited source.
CO2_working_capacity_cycle_mmol_g_notes: Source reports adsorption capacity at 0.15 bar CO2 (25°C) but does not report a defined adsorption–desorption working capacity under DAC-like cycling.
Metric_confidence_notes: Only non-DAC adsorption capacity metrics identified (e.g., 0.15 bar); no defined DAC cycle/energy/kinetics extracted.

material_name_notes: Often referred to as MFM-300(Al) / NOTT-300(Al) in the literature.
Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: Physisorption at hydroxyl-rich pore surface (H-bonding/electrostatic interactions with CO2).
Data_source_ref_notes: Nature Chemistry 2012 (Yang et al.; PMID:23037981) reporting high and selective CO2 uptake in NOTT-300(Al).
real_air_validation_criteria: Gas adsorption/isotherm characterization; DAC-condition (400 ppm) cycling not identified in accessible sources.
Metric_confidence_notes: Only high-level source identified; DAC-condition metrics not extracted here.

material_name_notes: Diamine-appended Mg2(dobpdc) (mmen = N,N′-dimethylethylenediamine); cooperative adsorption material for low pCO2.
Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: CO2 chemisorption via cooperative insertion in diamine-appended framework (step-shaped isotherm).
Data_source_ref_notes: CO2 isotherm tabulated near pCO2≈0.4 mbar at 298 K in SI Table S5; abstract reports cycling from ~390 ppm CO2 in air.
real_air_validation_criteria: Simulated ambient air (~390 ppm CO2) adsorption/desorption cycling; desorption at 80 °C; reported stable over 80 cycles (see paper abstract).
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: From McDonald et al. 2012 SI Table S5: q=2.014 mmol/g at P@298=0.40165 mbar (≈400 ppm CO2 at 1 bar total), single-component CO2; dry (no RH specified).
CO2_working_capacity_cycle_mmol_g_notes: From abstract: adsorption from 390 ppm CO2 in air for 1 h gave 1.05 mmol/g and could be fully desorbed at 80 °C; treated here as cyclic capacity (dry/humidity not specified).
Metric_confidence_notes: Quantitative 400 ppm uptake and cyclic capacity reported; humidity effects not quantified at RH50.

material_name_notes: Hydrated/compositional variant reported for mmen-appended Mg2(dobpdc); composition reflects partial amine occupancy and residual H2O.
Data_source_ref_notes: Composition notation taken from McDonald et al. (2012); uptake value taken from same SI table for mmen-appended sample (exact stoichiometry may differ by batch).
real_air_validation_criteria: Same source as mmen-Mg2(dobpdc); specific hydrated stoichiometry not independently validated in a separate DAC test.
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: Using McDonald et al. 2012 SI Table S5 value for mmen-appended sample at pCO2≈0.4 mbar, 298 K; treat as approximate for this hydrated stoichiometry (dry; not RH50).
Metric_confidence_notes: Hydrated stoichiometry not separately parameterized; used same 0.4 mbar CO2 uptake as the parent mmen-appended sample.

material_name_notes: Also referred to as A-PEI-1800 in Lin et al. (MIL-101(Cr) ~150 nm impregnated with branched PEI, Mw~1800).
Data_source_ref_notes: Paper studies particle-size and PEI molecular-weight effects (PEI Mw 300/1800/10000) on CO2 isotherms at 25/50 °C for 0–2 bar; no explicit 400 ppm humid-air value reported.
real_air_validation_criteria: Pure-gas CO2/N2 adsorption isotherms; flue-gas relevant mixture discussion (no ambient-air cycling reported).
Metric_confidence_notes: No DAC-condition (400 ppm + humidity) working-capacity or cycling metrics located in source.

material_name_notes: Polyamine-decorated MIL-101(Cr) with ~75 wt% PEI loading (as reported in early polyamine-decorated MOF work).
Data_source_ref_notes: ChemComm 2013 reports polyamine-decorated MOF adsorbents with different PEI loadings (incl. 75 wt%) primarily for higher-pressure CO2 capture/selectivity; DAC-condition values not identified.
real_air_validation_criteria: Adsorption isotherms/selectivity in CO2/CH4 and related mixtures (no 400 ppm DAC cycle reported).
Metric_confidence_notes: No 400 ppm CO2 uptake or DAC cycling metrics located in this source.

material_name_notes: Triamine-grafted pore-expanded MCM-41 mesoporous silica (Sayari/Belmabkhout).
Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: CO2 chemisorption on grafted amines (carbamate/bicarbonate pathways; humidity can enhance uptake).
Data_source_ref_notes: Kulkarni & Sholl (2012) air-capture process model uses Toth-type isotherm parameters in SI (Table S4) for TRI-PE-MCM-41 under dry-gas assumption.
real_air_validation_criteria: Process modeling study using literature isotherms; assumes dry CO2/N2 due to limited humid isotherm data (see paper and SI).
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: Calculated from Kulkarni & Sholl 2012 SI Eq. (S1) and Table S4 parameters at 298 K for pCO2=0.0004 bar (dry; not RH50).
Metric_confidence_notes: Value is model-based (derived from fitted isotherm parameters) and humidity effects not included.

material_name_notes: MIL-101(Cr) impregnated with ~50 wt% PEI (amine-impregnated composite for sub-ambient DAC study).
real_air_validation_criteria: 400 ppm CO2 adsorption (CO2/He) via SAP method; temperature dependence studied; kinetics discussed (no outdoor air).
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: From Rim et al. 2022 (JACS Au) Table 1: 50 wt% PEI/MIL-101(Cr) uptake 1.81±0.17 mmol/g at 400 ppm CO2 and 25°C (dry CO2/He; not RH50).
Metric_confidence_notes: Direct 400 ppm data reported, but in dry CO2/He and not a defined cyclic working-capacity under humid air.

material_name_notes: Piperazine-grafted CPO-27-Ni (aka MOF-74(Ni) derivative).
Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: Open-metal-site framework with grafted amine functionality; capture mechanism depends on grafting degree.
Data_source_ref_notes: Bernini et al. 2015 compiles CO2 uptake at 5, 50, 150 mbar and 1 bar for various MOFs and amine-grafted CPO-27; pip-CPO-27-Ni values listed but no 0.4 mbar (400 ppm) value reported.
real_air_validation_criteria: Pure-gas CO2 isotherm data at mbar–bar range (no explicit ambient-air test identified).
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: No 0.4 mbar (400 ppm) uptake value found in the cited compiled table; table reports pip-CPO-27-Ni uptake at 50 mbar = 0.8 mmol/g, 150 mbar = 1.25 mmol/g, 1 bar = 3.2 mmol/g (298 K).
Metric_confidence_notes: No direct 400 ppm uptake/working-capacity values located.

material_name_notes: MIL-101(Cr) impregnated with tetraethylenepentamine (TEPA); Rim et al. report 50 wt% TEPA/MIL-101(Cr).
real_air_validation_criteria: 400 ppm CO2 adsorption (CO2/He) via SAP method; temperature dependence studied.
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: From Rim et al. 2022 (JACS Au) Table 1: 50 wt% TEPA/MIL-101(Cr) uptake 2.14±0.12 mmol/g at 400 ppm CO2 and 25°C (dry CO2/He; not RH50).
Metric_confidence_notes: Direct 400 ppm uptake reported, but in dry CO2/He and not a defined cyclic working-capacity under humid air.

material_name_notes: Amino-functionalized UiO-66(Zr) (2-aminoterephthalate linker).
Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: Primarily physisorption with possible weak chemisorption contribution from –NH2; not a cooperative-step DAC sorbent.
Data_source_ref_notes: Cao et al. 2018 (Materials) reports CO2 isotherms for UiO-66-NH2 at 273/298/318 K up to ~1.2 bar; no 400 ppm uptake at RH50 reported.
real_air_validation_criteria: Pure-gas CO2 adsorption isotherms (0–1.2 bar) at multiple temperatures.
Metric_confidence_notes: No low-partial-pressure (0.4 mbar) DAC capacity/working-capacity metrics identified.

material_name_notes: Also referred to as A-PEI-10000 in Lin et al. (MIL-101(Cr) ~150 nm impregnated with branched PEI, Mw~10000).
Data_source_ref_notes: Paper reports CO2/N2 isotherms for PEI Mw 300/1800/10000 on MIL-101(Cr) nanoparticles at 25/50 °C (0–2 bar); no explicit 400 ppm humid-air value reported.
real_air_validation_criteria: Pure-gas CO2/N2 adsorption isotherms; flue-gas relevant mixture discussion (no ambient-air cycling reported).
Metric_confidence_notes: No DAC-condition (400 ppm + humidity) working-capacity or cycling metrics located in source.

material_name_notes: Ethylenediamine-grafted variant of sodalite-type MOF JLU-Liu2 (Cu4Cl-based framework) reported by Wang et al.
Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: Open-metal-site framework plus grafted ethylenediamine (amine-functionalized).
Data_source_ref_notes: Dalton Trans. 2014 paper (and SI) describes preparation of JLU-Liu2-en and reports N2 sorption; CO2 isotherm for grafted variant not tabulated in SI.
real_air_validation_criteria: Framework characterization and sorption studies; no DAC-condition cycle metrics located.
Metric_confidence_notes: No 400 ppm uptake/working-capacity metrics for JLU-Liu2-en identified in accessible SI.

material_name_notes: N-methylethylenediamine-functionalized CuBTTri (men-CuBTTri in McDonald et al. 2011).
Data_source_ref_notes: ESI Table S5 provides dual-site Langmuir parameters for CO2 in men-CuBTTri enabling calculation at 400 ppm (p=40 Pa).
real_air_validation_criteria: Pure-gas CO2 adsorption isotherms fit with dual-site Langmuir model (298–318 K).
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: Calculated using ESI Table S5 dual-site Langmuir parameters for CO2 in men-CuBTTri at 298 K; evaluated at pCO2=40 Pa (0.0004 bar; dry; not RH50).
Metric_confidence_notes: Value is computed from isotherm parameters (single-component CO2) and not validated in humid air or cycling.

material_name_notes: Size-controlled MIL-101(Cr) nanocrystal sample (~150 nm, 'sample A' in Lin et al. J. Mater. Chem. A 2014).
Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: MIL-101(Cr) has coordinatively unsaturated Cr sites after activation; CO2 captured primarily via physisorption with strong interactions at metal sites and pore surface.
Form_factor_tested_notes: Nanocrystal powder; mean particle size ~150 nm.
Data_source_ref_notes: Lin et al., J. Mater. Chem. A (2014): size-controlled MIL-101(Cr) nanoparticles (A~150 nm, B~250 nm) and PEI-impregnated composites; reports CO2 uptake for bare MIL-101(Cr).
real_air_validation_criteria: Pure-gas CO2 adsorption isotherms/uptake reported for bare MIL-101(Cr) nanoparticles at 25°C (dry CO2); no humid-air/400 ppm DAC cycling reported.
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: No 400 ppm + RH50 value reported in source. For context, bare MIL-101(Cr)-150nm (sample A) CO2 uptake reported at 0.15 bar and 25°C: 0.52 mmol/g (dry CO2).
Metric_confidence_notes: Data are for dry CO2 at elevated partial pressure (0.15 bar), not DAC (400 ppm) and not humid air.

Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: MIL-101(Cr) has coordinatively unsaturated Cr sites after activation; CO2 captured primarily via physisorption with strong interactions at metal sites and pore surface.
real_air_validation_criteria: Pure-gas CO2 adsorption isotherms/characterization on MIL-101(Cr) nanoparticles (~250 nm); no humid-air cycling reported in this source.

Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: MIL-101(Cr) physisorption with strong CO2 affinity attributed to open Cr sites and pore surface; study evaluates regeneration and flue-gas contaminant effects.
Data_source_ref_notes: Scientific Reports 3, 2916 (2013): fixed-bed CO2 adsorption on MIL-101(Cr) with flue-gas contaminants (H2O/NO/SO2), regeneration conditions (TSA vs VTSA), and 5-cycle stability.
real_air_validation_criteria: Fixed-bed breakthrough adsorption under 10 vol% CO2/N2 at 298 K; contaminants H2O (RH 10%), NO and SO2 tested (each added to feed). Cyclic tests: 5 adsorption/regeneration cycles with 10 vol% CO2, 100 ppm SO2, 100 ppm NO, RH 10% at 298 K; regeneration achieved in 10 min by TSA-N2 stripping at 328 K or VTSA at 348 K and 20 kPa.
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: No 400 ppm DAC uptake reported in source. Reported fixed-bed adsorption capacity under 10 vol% CO2/N2 at 298 K is 0.495 mmol/g (breakthrough-integrated).
CO2_working_capacity_cycle_mmol_g_notes: Using source's fixed-bed capacity at 298 K for 10 vol% CO2/N2 (0.495 mmol/g) as per-cycle working capacity, assuming full regeneration (source reports complete regeneration under stated conditions). Not DAC (400 ppm).
Regen_temperature_C_notes: TSA-N2 stripping full regeneration at 328 K (≈55°C) for 10 min (N2 flow 50 cm3/min). Alternative VTSA: 348 K (≈75°C) at 20 kPa for 10 min.
Regen_mode_notes: Source reports complete regeneration in 10 min by TSA with N2 stripping at 328 K (50 cm3/min N2). Also reports vacuum-temperature swing (VTSA/TVSA) at 348 K and 20 kPa.
Metric_confidence_notes: Bench-scale breakthrough + explicit regeneration conditions + 5-cycle test with contaminants and RH10%. However, performance is at 10% CO2 (flue gas), not 400 ppm DAC.

Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: Hybrid composite of MIL-101(Cr) with multi-walled carbon nanotubes; CO2 captured primarily via physisorption (MOF pores/open sites) with composite effects on capacity/kinetics.
real_air_validation_criteria: Synthesis/characterization and CO2 adsorption testing of MWCNT@MIL-101 composite (pure-gas adsorption; not DAC humidity).

material_name_notes: CuBTTri functionalized by grafting piperazine (Pip) to open Cu(II) sites.
Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: Piperazine grafted to CuBTTri; CO2 chemisorption proposed (DRIFTS; high initial Qst).
Data_source_ref_notes: Microporous and Mesoporous Materials (2013): piperazine-grafted CuBTTri (Pip-CuBTTri) for selective CO2 capture from CO2/N2 mixtures.
real_air_validation_criteria: Dry-gas CO2/N2 adsorption isotherms at 293 K; IAST CO2/N2 selectivity reported; TGA cycling at 40°C with 0.15 bar CO2 in N2 (ads) and N2 purge (des). No humidity/real-air DAC.
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: No 400 ppm + RH50 data in source. For context (dry CO2): uptake at 0.15 bar, 293 K reported as 0.75 mmol/g; total uptake at 1 bar, 293 K reported as 1.8 mmol/g.
CO2_working_capacity_cycle_mmol_g_notes: Derived from TGA cycling: adsorption at 40°C under 0.15 bar CO2 (balance N2) for 30 min (mass +~2.6 wt%); desorption/regeneration by N2 purge at 40°C for 30 min (mass −~1.8 wt%). Working capacity Δq corresponds to ~1.8 wt% CO2 swing (~0.409 mmol/g). Incomplete regeneration of first cycle noted (~0.2 mmol/g retained).
Full_cycle_time_min_notes: TGA cycle definition in source: 30 min adsorption (CO2/N2) + 30 min desorption (N2 purge).
Sorbent_productivity_grav_kgCO2_per_kg_p: Calculated from Δq=1.8 wt% CO2 per 60 min cycle: (0.018 kg CO2/kg sorbent·cycle)×(1440/60 cycles/day)=0.432 kg CO2/kg/day.
Regen_temperature_C_notes: Chosen cycle uses isothermal regeneration at 40°C via N2 purge (pressure/purge swing). Separate temperature-swing tests in source indicate >66% CO2 removal by heating to 80°C.
Regen_mode_notes: Pressure/purge swing regeneration (N2 purge at ~1 bar) at constant temperature (40°C); not vacuum swing.
Metric_confidence_notes: Good lab evidence for CO2/N2 selectivity and cycling at flue-gas-relevant CO2 partial pressure (0.15 bar), but no humid-air or 400 ppm (DAC) performance reported.

Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: Zr-based MOF NU-1000 functionalized via solvent-assisted ligand incorporation (SALI) with DAP (2,6-diacetylaminopyridine-4-carboxylate) at Zr6 nodes; CO2 binding enhanced by complementary organic motifs (amide/pyridine) + framework sites (physisorption-dominated).
Data_source_ref_notes: Deria et al., Chem. Commun. (2015): NU-1000 platform functionalized by SALI with DAP (and F3G). ESI reports dual-site Langmuir fits (273–303 K) and working capacities for PSA/VSA (293 K).
real_air_validation_criteria: Single-component CO2/N2 isotherms (273–303 K) measured on IGA and modeled (dual-site Langmuir); PSA/VSA working capacities estimated from 293 K isotherms. No humidity/real-air cycling.
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: No humid-air (RH50) DAC data in source. Using dual-site Langmuir fit parameters at 293 K (dry CO2), predicted uptake at 400 ppm (P≈40 Pa) is ~0.0017 mmol/g; linear interpolation of fit parameters to 298 K gives ~0.0014 mmol/g (dry). For context, gravimetric uptake at 1 bar and 273 K reported as 2.29 mmol/g.
CO2_working_capacity_cycle_mmol_g_notes: From ESI Table SI-5 (293 K CO2 isotherm, dry): VSA working capacity between 0.225 bar (adsorption) and 0.0075 bar (regeneration) is 0.53 mmol/g.
Regen_temperature_C_notes: Working capacity derived from 293 K (≈20°C) CO2 isotherm; no temperature swing specified.
Regen_mode_notes: Cycle context uses VSA endpoints defined in source (0.225→0.0075 bar) at 293 K.
Metric_confidence_notes: ESI provides clear isotherm model + PSA/VSA working capacities at 293 K (dry), but no humid-air data and no 400 ppm DAC cycling; relevance to DAC metrics therefore limited.

material_name_notes: M41S-type mesoporous silica sample (AM2); synthesis gel composition (e.g., Na2O/SiO2) specified in source.
Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: M41S-type mesoporous silica (MCM-41 family) synthesized with different gel compositions; CO2 capture via physisorption with surface/cation effects (not amine chemisorption).
Data_source_ref_notes: Gargiulo et al., Science of Advanced Materials 7(2) (2015): CO2 and N2 isotherms at 293 K on siliceous nanoporous materials (Silicalite-1 and M41S-type mesoporous samples AM1–AM3) fitted by Freundlich model; IAST used to estimate CO2/N2 selectivity and PSA/VSA working capacities.
real_air_validation_criteria: CO2 and N2 adsorption isotherms at 293 K collected for M41S AM samples, fitted by Freundlich; IAST used to assess CO2/N2 separation for hypothetical PSA/VSA. No humidity/real-air cycling.
Metric_confidence_notes: Only abstract-level information was accessible (full text/PDF blocked), so quantitative metrics (isotherm parameters, capacities, selectivities) were not extracted.

material_name_notes: PEI-impregnated mesoporous sponge-like TUD-1 silica (molecular basket sorbent).
Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: PEI immobilized on mesoporous silica; CO2 captured via amine chemisorption; moisture reported to enhance capacity.
Data_source_ref_notes: Primary: Wang et al., Catalysis Today 238 (2014) 95–102 (PEI/TUD-1 fixed-bed in simulated flue gas; moisture effect; cycling). Related: Gargiulo et al., J. Colloid Interface Sci. 367 (2012) 348–354, DOI 10.1016/j.jcis.2011.10.038 (volumetric CO2 isotherms on PEI-functionalized TUD-1; Langmuir modeling).
real_air_validation_criteria: Fixed-bed flow testing in simulated flue gas; examined PEI loading (best reported ~50 wt% PEI) and moisture (3 vol% H2O); reported sorption capacities at 75°C and ran 45 sorption–desorption cycles.
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: Not reported at 400 ppm/25°C/RH50. Reported max CO2 sorption capacity at 75°C: 116 mg/g (=2.64 mmol/g) dry; 130 mg/g (=2.95 mmol/g) with 3 vol% moisture (simulated flue gas conditions).

material_name_notes: Size-controlled MIL-101(Cr) nanocrystal sample (~250 nm, 'sample B' in Lin et al. J. Mater. Chem. A 2014).
Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: MIL-101(Cr) has coordinatively unsaturated Cr sites after activation; CO2 captured primarily via physisorption with strong interactions at metal sites and pore surface.
Data_source_ref_notes: Lin et al., J. Mater. Chem. A (2014): size-controlled MIL-101(Cr) nanoparticles (A~150 nm, B~250 nm) and PEI-impregnated composites; reports CO2 uptake for bare MIL-101(Cr).
real_air_validation_criteria: Pure-gas CO2 adsorption characterization reported for size-controlled MIL-101(Cr) nanoparticles (incl. ~250 nm); no humid air or defined DAC cycle.

material_name_notes: Macro-/mesoporous silica monolith (MonoSil) functionalized with PEI; pellet-shaped monolith suitable for packed-column operation.
Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: Polyethylenimine functionalized macro-/mesoporous silica monolith; CO2 captured via amine chemisorption (supported amine).
Data_source_ref_notes: Gargiulo et al., Microporous and Mesoporous Materials 215 (2015) 1–7: PEI-functionalized macro-/mesoporous silica monoliths (PEI-MonoSil); CO2 isotherms at 298/313/333/348 K up to 100 kPa (volumetric); Toth model used; isosteric heat evaluated vs coverage.
real_air_validation_criteria: Single-component CO2 adsorption isotherms at 298/313/333/348 K up to 100 kPa measured by volumetric technique; modeled with Toth isotherm; no humid air cycling.

material_name_notes: M41S-type mesoporous silica sample (AM3); synthesis gel composition specified in source.
Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: Siliceous mesoporous silica (M41S/MCM-41 family); CO2 uptake dominated by weak physisorption on silanol surface sites (not amine/chemisorption).
Data_source_ref_notes: Gargiulo et al., Science of Advanced Materials 7(2) (2015): CO2 and N2 isotherms at 293 K on siliceous nanoporous materials (Silicalite-1 and M41S-type mesoporous samples AM1–AM3) fitted by Freundlich model; IAST used to estimate CO2/N2 selectivity and PSA/VSA working capacities.
real_air_validation_criteria: CO2 and N2 adsorption isotherms at 293 K collected for M41S AM samples, fitted by Freundlich; IAST used to assess CO2/N2 separation for hypothetical PSA/VSA. No humidity/real-air cycling.

Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: Zr-based MOF NU-1000 functionalized via solvent-assisted ligand incorporation (SALI) with F3G (Fmoc-Gly-Gly-Gly-OH) at Zr6 nodes; CO2 binding enhanced by complementary organic motifs (amide) + framework sites (physisorption-dominated).
Data_source_ref_notes: Chem. Commun. 2015 (Deria et al.). Used ESI (c5cc04808g1.pdf): Table SI-2 (dual-site Langmuir fits) and Table SI-5 (working capacities).
real_air_validation_criteria: Dry-gas single-component CO2/N2 isotherms (273–303 K) + IAST selectivity; no humid-air DAC cycling.
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: No humid-air (RH50) DAC data in source. Using dual-site Langmuir fit parameters (ESI Table SI-2) at 293 K (dry CO2), predicted uptake at 400 ppm (P≈40 Pa) is ~0.00061 mmol/g; linear interpolation of b1,b2 from 293→303 K gives ~0.00054 mmol/g at 298 K (dry).
CO2_working_capacity_cycle_mmol_g_notes: From ESI Table SI-5 (293 K CO2 isotherm, dry): VSA working capacity between 0.225 bar (adsorption) and 0.0075 bar (regeneration) is 0.33 mmol/g.
Regen_mode_notes: Cycle context uses VSA endpoints defined in source (0.225→0.0075 bar) at 293 K (dry).

Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: Zr-based MIL-140 framework; CO2 capture dominated by physisorption/electrostatic interactions in narrow micropores (no open-metal-site chemisorption).
Data_source_ref_notes: Chem. Commun. 2015 (Biswas et al.). Table 1 reports CO2 uptake at 0.15 bar and 293 K, Qst0, and IAST CO2/N2 selectivity.
real_air_validation_criteria: Dry-gas CO2/N2 adsorption isotherms + IAST selectivity; no humid-air DAC cycling.
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: No 400 ppm (RH50) DAC data in source. Reported CO2 uptake at 0.15 bar and 293 K: 0.18 mmol/g; Qst0: 31.9 kJ/mol; IAST selectivity CO2/N2 (15/85) at 293 K: 23.3 (dry gases).

Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: Zr-based MIL-140C-Me framework (methyl-substituted linker); CO2 capture dominated by physisorption/electrostatic interactions in micropores.
Data_source_ref_notes: Chem. Commun. 2015 (Biswas et al.). Table 1 reports CO2 uptake at 0.15 bar and 293 K, Qst0, and IAST CO2/N2 selectivity.
real_air_validation_criteria: Dry-gas CO2/N2 adsorption isotherms + IAST selectivity; no humid-air DAC cycling.
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: No 400 ppm (RH50) DAC data in source. Reported CO2 uptake at 0.15 bar and 293 K: 0.21 mmol/g; Qst0: 25.7 kJ/mol; IAST selectivity CO2/N2 (15/85) at 293 K: 22.6 (dry gases).

Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: Amino-functionalized MIL-101(Al); CO2 capture mainly via physisorption/acid-base and H-bond interactions from –NH2 (not an impregnated amine sorbent).
Data_source_ref_notes: Chem. Mater. 2011 (Serra-Crespo et al.). Abstract reports CO2 capacities up to 62 wt% at room temperature and 3 MPa (~14.1 mmol/g) and high thermal/chemical stability; not DAC conditions.
real_air_validation_criteria: Material synthesis/characterization + CO2 adsorption/separation performance (high-pressure) reported; not humid-air DAC cycling.
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: No humid-air (RH50) DAC data in source. Reported capacity is for high-pressure CO2: up to 62 wt% at room temperature and 3 MPa (~14.1 mmol/g).

Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: Zr-based MIL-140A-NH2 framework; CO2 capture dominated by physisorption with strong interactions from narrow pores + –NH2 functionalization (no impregnated amine chemisorption).
Data_source_ref_notes: Chem. Commun. 2015 (Biswas et al.). Table 1 reports CO2 uptake at 0.15 bar and 293 K, Qst0, and IAST CO2/N2 selectivity.
real_air_validation_criteria: Dry-gas CO2/N2 adsorption isotherms + IAST selectivity; no humid-air DAC cycling.
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: No 400 ppm (RH50) DAC data in source. Reported CO2 uptake at 0.15 bar and 293 K: 0.69 mmol/g; Qst0: 43.4 kJ/mol; IAST selectivity CO2/N2 (15/85) at 293 K: 134.2 (dry gases).

Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: UiO-67/MCM-41 hybrid adsorbent; CO2 capture dominated by physisorption on MOF/silica pore surfaces (pre-combustion PSA context; not DAC).
Data_source_ref_notes: Adsorption 2012 (Casas et al.) equilibrium data for pre-combustion PSA; supplementary tables include pure CO2/H2 excess adsorption on UiO-67/MCM-41 at 25–100°C. Related PSA process paper: 10.1016/j.seppur.2013.03.042.
real_air_validation_criteria: High-pressure CO2/H2 adsorption equilibria for PSA pre-combustion capture (not air); no humid-air DAC cycling.
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: No 400 ppm (RH50) DAC data in source. Pure CO2 excess adsorption on UiO-67/MCM-41 at 25°C (selected points): 0.876 mmol/g at 0.11 MPa (~1.1 bar), 1.538 mmol/g at 0.21 MPa, 3.160 mmol/g at 0.51 MPa, 5.101 mmol/g at 0.98 MPa, 9.990 mmol/g at 6.22 MPa (excess uptake; high-pressure PSA context).

Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: M41S-type mesoporous silica (MCM-41 family) synthesized with different gel compositions; CO2 capture via physisorption with surface/cation effects (not amine chemisorption).
Data_source_ref_notes: Science of Advanced Materials 2015 (Gargiulo et al.), DOI 10.1166/sam.2015.2137. Study/modeling of CO2/N2 adsorption on Silicalite-1 and pure-silica MCM-41 (M41S) samples AM1/AM2/AM3 using 293 K adsorption isotherms and Freundlich fits; selectivity calculations. No humid air and not a defined DAC cycle.
real_air_validation_criteria: Lab; dry pure-gas CO2 and N2 equilibrium isotherms at 293 K (model fits / selectivity modeling). No humid-air DAC cycling reported.

Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: Zr-based MIL-140 framework; CO2 capture via physisorption in narrow one-dimensional channels; functionalization (e.g., -NH2, -F, -Me) tunes adsorption.
Data_source_ref_notes: Chem. Commun. 2015 (Liang et al.), DOI 10.1039/C5CC02539G. ESI Table S5 provides dual-site Langmuir–Freundlich parameters for CO2/N2 at 293 K; Table 1 reports CO2/N2 coadsorption selectivity at 293 K (single-point) and nCO2 at 0.15 bar. Used ESI Table S5 to compute low-pressure (400 ppm ≈ 0.4 mbar) dry CO2 uptake.
real_air_validation_criteria: Lab; dry CO2 and N2 isotherms (293/303/313 K) + IAST/selectivity analysis; no real-air humid breakthrough or defined DAC cycling.
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: Computed from DSLF fit (ESI Table S5) at 293 K (dry). Assumed 400 ppm CO2 = 0.4 mbar at 1 bar total. Not measured at 25°C/RH50.

Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: Zr-based MIL-140 framework; CO2 capture via physisorption in narrow one-dimensional channels; functionalization (e.g., -NH2, -F, -Me) tunes adsorption.
Data_source_ref_notes: Chem. Commun. 2015 (Liang et al.), DOI 10.1039/C5CC02539G. Fluorinated MIL-140A (bdc-F). ESI Table S5 provides DSLF fit parameters for CO2/N2 at 293 K; used to compute 400 ppm (0.4 mbar) dry CO2 uptake.
real_air_validation_criteria: Lab; dry CO2 and N2 isotherms (293/303/313 K) + selectivity/IAST analysis; no real-air humid breakthrough or DAC cycling.
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: Computed from DSLF fit (ESI Table S5) at 293 K (dry). Assumed 400 ppm CO2 = 0.4 mbar at 1 bar total. Not measured at 25°C/RH50.

Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: Zr-based MIL-140 framework; CO2 capture via physisorption in narrow one-dimensional channels; functionalization (e.g., -NH2, -F, -Me) tunes adsorption.
Data_source_ref_notes: Chem. Commun. 2015 (Liang et al.), DOI 10.1039/C5CC02539G. MIL-140D (azobdc-Cl) included in ESI; DSLF fit parameters for CO2/N2 at 293 K given in ESI Table S5; used to compute 400 ppm (0.4 mbar) dry CO2 uptake.
real_air_validation_criteria: Lab; dry CO2 and N2 isotherms (293/303/313 K) + selectivity/IAST analysis; no real-air humid breakthrough or DAC cycling.
qCO2_400ppm_25C_RH50_mmol_g_notes: Computed from DSLF fit (ESI Table S5) at 293 K (dry). Assumed 400 ppm CO2 = 0.4 mbar at 1 bar total. Not measured at 25°C/RH50.

material_name_notes: Structural configuration of disordered valerate groups used in the source paper/ESI; not a separately validated DAC cycle.
Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: Cobalt-adeninate bio-MOF with pore-decorating valerate chains; CO2 capture via physisorption + molecular-sieving (CO2 adsorbs while N2 is excluded at 273/298 K per source).
Data_source_ref_notes: Chem. Sci. 2013 (Li et al.), DOI 10.1039/C3SC22207A. bio-MOF-14 (valerate-decorated cobalt-adeninate) reported to adsorb CO2 but not N2 at 273 and 298 K (molecular sieving); increased water stability with chain length; bio-MOF-14 retains crystallinity/porosity after soaking in water for one month. ‘Configuration’ refers to a specific valerate-chain disorder model used for analysis.
real_air_validation_criteria: Lab; CO2/N2 equilibrium adsorption measurements at 273 and 298 K (dry gas) plus water-soaking stability test. No humid-air DAC cycling.

material_name_notes: Structural configuration of disordered valerate groups used in the source paper/ESI; not a separately validated DAC cycle.
Active_site_type_capture_mechanism_notes: Cobalt-adeninate bio-MOF with pore-decorating valerate chains; CO2 capture via physisorption + molecular-sieving (CO2 adsorbs while N2 is excluded at 273/298 K per source).
Data_source_ref_notes: Chem. Sci. 2013 (Li et al.), DOI 10.1039/C3SC22207A. bio-MOF-14 (valerate-decorated cobalt-adeninate) reported to adsorb CO2 but not N2 at 273 and 298 K (molecular sieving); increased water stability with chain length; bio-MOF-14 retains crystallinity/porosity after soaking in water for one month. ‘Configuration’ refers to a specific valerate-chain disorder model used for analysis.
real_air_validation_criteria: Lab; CO2/N2 equilibrium adsorption measurements at 273 and 298 K (dry gas) plus water-soaking stability test. No humid-air DAC cycling.
